title: (45600) Talavera de la Reina -

Ideal for bike ride or hiking. No light from streetlights. Enough spaces to park with shade. The entrance section has quite a few potholes.

There are garbage cans next door and a playground, but very little crowded. Of course, there were many flies so better with a mosquito net !!

title: (45638) Pepino - 127 TO-1280

title: (45638) Pepino - 127 TO-1280

title: (45646) Serranillos Playa -
description: Car park located 1.4km from the bathing area of the Cazalegas reservoir. The car park is frequented by fishermen, close to the road but at night they hardly pass by, a quiet place. Good access for all types of vehicles, very level ground and garbage container at the entrance.

title: (45683) Cazalegas - Embalse Cazalegas
description: Picnic area and parking next to the tank. Excellent views

title: (45664) Las Herencias - 4 Calle Parque
description: Directly on the river, no bans, solid underground. The other place could not be reached with our camper. Lots of noise at night. Night anglers with techno music, dog concert in the village, shots from hunters in the morning.

title: (45664) Las Herencias - 26 Calle Cerro Pendón
description: Service area for motorhomes, it has a tap to load water, a box for black water, emptying gray water is complicated, but it can be done. in the town there are shops and the viewpoint of the castles is very close, it is also very quiet and the people I have asked very kind and helpful

name: Camping Cazalegas
title: (45683) Camping Cazalegas
description: Camping with spectacular views of the Cazalegas reservoir. water loading and unloading area

title: (45646) Serranillos Playa - TO-1261
description: Mixed parking near the reservoir, next to a campsite with paid services, chargeable parking, some unevenness, some shady areas, it's okay to hang out in the swamp.

title: (45664) Las Herencias - Calle Estación
description: Good park with tables and games for children. Access to the reservoir for boats. Barbecue and viewpoint with great views of the sunset. Flat parking and we spent the night without any noise. To access with a motorhome you have to touch some trees a bit.

title: (45686) Calera y Chozas - 67 Avenida Benito Alcalde Sánchez
title_short: (45686) Calera y Chozas - 67 Avenida Benito Alcalde Sánchez
description: Spacey parking near a sports complex. Busy traffic around during the day and traffic noise at night. However, this is likely the only option in Calera y Chozas. It is also the only option for a night for those who are there for bird watching. The local guide organizes photography of great bustards and other birds from hides. As this is popular parking it seems to be quite safe to leave a car for a whole day (when you are in the bird hide). You can park here or drive a bit further to park between the complex and the main road.

title: (45654) San Bartolomé de las Abiertas - 3 Calle Escuelas
title_short: (45654) San Bartolomé de las Abiertas - 3 Calle Escuelas
description: Municipal motorhome area, with free overnight, has gray / black water emptying service and a tower with 2 taps, one for drinking water and another to wash the sewage tank. In addition to being close to shops, municipal swimming pool and other services.

title: (45686) Calera y Chozas - 5 CM-4160
description: Large, clean picnic area next to a small church. Only grills, dumpster. No water or service. Toilets unfortunately completed. 5km from the next village, isolated, lonely and absolutely quiet as there is no traffic on this side street.

title: (45642) Cardiel de los Montes - 4 Calle Rollo
title_short: (45642) Cardiel de los Montes - 4 Calle Rollo
description: Dirt parking at the entrance to the town where overnight stays are authorized. The town has a free motorhome area but in summer, given its location near a park, the nights can be a little noisy due to the youth of the town. This is why the town hall provides this parking lot for a quieter night. As of 06/09/23, following a breakdown caused by storm DANA, this town, like 70 towns in the region, has no water.

title: (45642) Cardiel de los Montes - 30 Calle Libertad
title_short: (45642) Cardiel de los Montes - 30 Calle Libertad
description: Free municipal motorhome area that has 4 spaces with gray and black water loading and unloading services. Please refrain from vehicles that ARE NOT motorhomes or campers (vans with a mattress) because they will be expelled by the municipal authority. This measure is taken due to the misuse of the area that these users have offered, leaving the surroundings quite dirty. As of 09/06/23, due to a breakdown caused by storm DANA, this municipality, like 70 towns in the region, does not have water.

title: (45686) Calera y Chozas - Unnamed Road
description: Flat gravel esplanade in the old silos stop, next to the Vía Verde de la Jara. There are some wooden tables and a garbage container. it is clean, although abandoned (there is weed). please keep it clean. 4 km following the greenway to the southwest (towards Aldeanueva de Barbarolla), you come to a viaduct over the gorge. the route is beautiful and flat, easy to go with children. the only thing necessary is to bring light, because you go through two tunnels.

title: (45640) Navamorcuende - TO-9045-V

title: (45640) El Real de San Vicente -

title: () Navamorcuende - TO-9045-V
description: In the countryside, recreation area with football field. I highly recommend the climb to the mount and its castle (spectacular views of the Castilian Mancha plateau). and the way to the antennas (gredos see). very quiet area. quite busy on weekends

title: (45611) Parrillas - Camino de la Ermita
description: Flat and very quiet. I was looking for the hermitage which is supposed to be a few meters away and it is dark. It was perfect for the night

has shade
room for a van or AC.

name: Área de autocaravanas | Piscina Municipal de Parrillas
title: (45611) Área de autocaravanas | Piscina Municipal de Parrillas
title_short: (45611) Área de autocaravanas | Piscina Municipal de Parrillas
description: Camper place to stay overnight next to the municipal swimming pool. Parking for 3 RVs with BBQ and sink, tables and benches. One can empty gray and black water. To gain access you can ask for the key at the pool in summer from the end of June to the beginning of September. Outside of this season, ask the town hall in advance to provide the key for you. The town has a butcher, a pharmacy, 2 grocery stores and 2 bars apart from the one by the pool which serves meals.

title: () Santa Ana de Pusa - CM-401
description: Ample parking next to the cemetery. next to the road. quiet at night.

title: (45653) Santa Ana de Pusa - 39 Calle del Quinto
title_short: (45653) Santa Ana de Pusa - 39 Calle del Quinto
description: Picnic area by the swimming pool, not far from the hardly used street. Large dumpster, three picnic tables, benches and trash cans. Certainly also suitable as an overnight place in the off-season, even for larger mobile homes.

title: (45610) Navalcán - Unnamed Road

title: (45569) Oropesa - Unnamed Road

title: (45569) Oropesa -

title: (05490) Lanzahíta - 126 Carretera de Madrid

title: (45560) Oropesa - 35B Calle Ferial

title: (05400) Arenas de San Pedro -
description: Parking next to the Puente de los Llanos, near a road that connects the Dehesa with the town of Arenas de San Pedro. Minimum traffic, full of nature, shade, on the banks of a pool in the Arenal River where you can take a dip. From here you can do the Fishermen's route and admire the spectacular river. There is no type of service but it is a spectacular point for its environment

title: (05470) Pedro Bernardo - Unnamed Road
description: Paragliding takeoff parking area. Access is difficult, and I think only suitable for 4x4s.

title: (05413) Mombeltrán - N-502
description: This place is only 5 min drive from a previous one (Leisure area of Playas Blancas). Just turn right after crossing a bridge leading to the recreational area. This place is much quieter and more natural. This is small parking right by a small stream and a tap with spring water. There are picnic tables nearby. You can enjoy a nice walk up along the stream which is truly beautiful. Great spot to have a lunch stop or spend a night as we did. Little traffic during the day and pleasantly quiet at night. Good for birdwatching. Frogs and newts live in an artificial pond below the tap with spring water. It is enough space for three vans/small campervans and one-two big motorhomes. There are several parking places for one vehicle further along the road. There is a good walk behind the source. Really nice waterfall and pools along an unmarked but well trodden path.

title: (05413) Playa Verde - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area with stone tables and fountain, on a very little traveled road. Forbidden to make fire. Possibility of doing bike routes and going to Santa Cruz to have a drink and buy supplies, there is also a municipal swimming pool.

title: (05413) Mombeltrán - Camino Forestal el Amociñan
description: Leisure area of ​​Playas Blancas, next to the river Ramacastañas. Very quiet, with ample parking and very wooded. It also offers a pleasant walk along a paved path, along the river.

name: Camping El Paraiso Hormigos Toledo
title: (45919) Camping El Paraiso Hormigos Toledo
description:
Camping located in the town of Hormigos.
Family camping, very attentive staff.
It lacks nothing. Pool, river, showers, sinks, wc. All free.
It has a bar where they make all kinds of meals, they also serve breakfast.
It has a shop with daily bread.
Very spacious plots.
Emptying and filling of water and electricity points.
Highly recommended.

title: (45570) El Puente del Arzobispo - 20 Calle Don Pedro Tenorio
title_short: (45570) El Puente del Arzobispo - 20 Calle Don Pedro Tenorio

No water point. No service.

Friendly farmer recommended the location. Space for more than two vehicles only if travelling together.

title: (05480) Candeleda - 225 Calle Camino del Lomo

title: (05480) Candeleda -

They parked in front of the hotel next to a small pond and got stuck. To avoid the risk as soon as you reach the corner of the hotel, take the path to the right to go to the esplanade next to the reservoir and some pine trees. 400m away is the area where the gps leaves you

It is usually a quiet environment and the people who arrive are from the area and are usually friendly. You can park at the foot of the road next to some picnic tables as in the photo of the motorhome or in the parking lot of the pool where they do not pass cars that are the other two photos. I am now that the pool is closed due to the covid so there is no one. In summer it is ideal to spend with the family with children because next to the pool there is an arboreal park and there are routes for the whole family.
